meanings.definition: Fletches (verb): to feather an arrow for flight
meanings.sent1: He carefully fletches his arrows before going hunting.
meanings.sent2: The skilled archer fletches each arrow with precision.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy archer accidentally fletches his own finger instead of the arrow.
meanings.sent4: Her words fletch my heart, piercing through with their honesty.
meanings.sent5: The ancient craftsman fletches the arrows with colorful feathers, making them beautiful and deadly.

meanings.definition: Fletches (noun): the feathers on an arrow
meanings.sent1: The fletches on the arrow help stabilize its flight.
meanings.sent2: He examined the fletches closely to ensure they were intact.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the fletches from the arrows to use in its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the soft rustle of fletches in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant fletches on the arrow stood out against the green backdrop of the forest.
